entry.title: Doyle spiral (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that circle packings in the form of a Doyle spiral (pictured) were used to model plant growth long before their mathematical investigation by Doyle?

entry.title: Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed, India's second Muslim president, was also the second Indian president to die in office?

entry.title: Piccolia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while some lichen species in the genus Piccolia have ranges which span multiple continents, others are restricted to single islands?

entry.title: Taylor Scott Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Stardust, the title of a composition by Taylor Scott Davis for eight voices a cappella commissioned by Voces8, became also the name of the vocal ensemble's 2022 tour?

entry.title: Solace Provincial Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the roadless Solace Provincial Park in the Temagami area of Ontario, Canada, is considered as one of the most isolated, wild places in the province?

entry.title: on strike against Scripto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the day after returning to Atlanta following his Nobel Peace Prize acceptance in 1964, Martin Luther King Jr. joined picketers who were on strike against Scripto?

entry.title: Conversation Piece at the Royal Lodge, Windsor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Herbert James Gunn used a paper cut-out of Princess Elizabeth's corgi dog to help him paint his Conversation Piece at the Royal Lodge, Windsor?

entry.title: Shaun Aguano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shaun Aguano's interview to join the Arizona State football coaching staff consisted only of being asked, "you want the job?"
